text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Prime Minister Hariri said in Paris that Israel was destroying peace. He returned from Damascus in the evening.
-Maronite Patriarch Sfeir: the government must not ignore its people's demands and needs.
-In an international conference on infrastructure in the region: Lebanon's debts are transforming into a time bomb.
-Foreign Minister Bouez in New York: The US-Israeli relations are weakening.
-Israeli shelling of the eastern and central sectors. One South Lebanon Army militiaman killed, another wounded by Israeli fire.
-If the government insists on the audiovisual law, protests and demonstrations will begin next week.
-One Israeli soldier killed and 11 wounded in 50 guerrilla attacks against patrols and outposts during September.
-Acting Finance Minister Siniora on his way to the consultative group meeting in New York: We hope to get donations and soft loans.
